snippet: Shortcomings continue particularly in discrimination against the Muslim Rohingya minority and abuses in northern Kachin State, the investigator said.
abstract: United Nations report states that political reforms that are delivering greater freedom in Myanmar could falter if authorities do not tackle some conspicuous failings, including continuing torture in prisons and discrimination against ethnic minorities.
lead_paragraph: Shortcomings continue particularly in discrimination against the Muslim Rohingya minority and abuses in northern Kachin State, the investigator said.

headline.seo: Myanmar Reforms Could Falter, U.N. Investigator Says
headline.main: Myanmar Reforms Could Falter, U.N. Investigator Says
headline.print_headline:
U.N. Report
Cites Failings
In Myanmar
